document_title: Multinodular goiter: Causes, signs and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Most cases of multinodular goiter have unclear causes. Multinodular goiter can develop from simple goiter and diffuse goiter. Additionally, Hashimoto's thyroiditis (autoimmune thyroiditis) is associated with a higher risk of thyroid nodules. (first)
Supplementing foods rich in iodine helps prevent multinodular goiter.
Risk factors for the disease include: Iodine deficiency, female gender, older age and a family with multinodular goiter. Nodules in goiter are formed and develop at different speeds, combined with factors such as medication, diet, and genes. This process takes place over many years, so it is common to notice an increase in the number of people with multinodular goiter in middle age and older.
